turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Our time's up.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What?!  There's nothing here!

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Look around...

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What the fuck is that?!

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Screamer.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: We can't reach that!

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: We don't have a choice!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: So that's what we almost died for?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: One of them, anyway...  Did you see it?  The Screamer?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I don't want to talk about it.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Christ...no time...

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: There never is.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: We can take the dunes down like a ski slope. Pretend you're on a snowboard.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Never been on a snowboard.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I just thought of something.  If we came back from the game...  ...what if ARCADE did too?

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: Listen to me, Alex.  These counselor's don't know anything.  They're full of shit. If you don't fit the pattern of the perfect kid, they freak.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: So tell me you're okay, then.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I'm okay.

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: Good.   Cause I'd freak if you weren't.

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: Come on.  We'll hit Dante's after school, try the game out, maybe get some dinner.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: And then keep on driving?

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: Sure.  Never come back.  Disappear forever.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Go for it.

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: Hold my keys, then.

turns.speaker: GREG
turns.text: So how did you do it, Alex?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Well, it's a long story...

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: How did you get here?  Did you play the game?!

turns.speaker: BOY
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Thought so.

turns.speaker: BOY
turns.text: Then we'll go home?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Then we'll go home.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Which way?

turns.speaker: BOY
turns.text: That way.

turns.speaker: BOY
turns.text: It's the wrong way!

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: In this world, wrong is right!

turns.speaker: BOY
turns.text: It's here!!!

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Oh God...oh god...

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: What did he do to you?

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Is that your question?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Wait!  No!  That's not it!

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Think!  I want to go to the City of Truth, and the Truth Teller is from there...but which one is which?  The liar...think!

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: You have no time.  What is your question?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: I'm thinking!

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: You have no time.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Mom?  You're alive...

turns.speaker: ALEX'S MOTHER
turns.text: Of course I am.

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: But I don't understand...

turns.speaker: ALEX'S MOTHER
turns.text: I miss you so much, Alex.  I want so much to be with you...

turns.speaker: ALEX'S MOTHER
turns.text: I love you, Alex.  I never wanted to leave. You know that, don't you?

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Yes...but...how did you...

turns.speaker: ALEX
turns.text: Is...is that where we are?  Did I die?

turns.speaker: ALEX'S MOTHER
turns.text: Not yet, honey...

turns.speaker: DIFFORD
turns.text: We're glad you people could make it, and we're anxious to have you try out our new product.  We think it's going to be a big seller.  But you're the people that make it happen.  You're the market share everyone's tearing each other apart to get at.  It's your opinion that's going to make or break us.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: So what's so different about Arcade? You guys've been talking about it for months.

turns.speaker: DIFFORD
turns.text: A man after my own heart.  Straight to the point.  What's different about ARCADE is the way it reacts.  It responds like a human does.  It learns.  It adapts. Each time you play, it changes its strategy.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: That's impossible.

turns.speaker: DIFFORD
turns.text: Is it?  Why don't you see for your self?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: "Escape"?

turns.speaker: DIFFORD
turns.text: In case things get too intense.  It automatically freezes the game, gives you a breather.  Things can get pretty wild...

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: So what's the scenario?  Am I saving a princess?  Fighting Zombies?

turns.speaker: DIFFORD
turns.text: It changes.  There are eleven levels. Each one is a different layer of the ARCADE universe.  The concept is, you're entering the video game itself, making your way across the circuit board to the logic core ... ARCADE's brain.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: So how do I start?

turns.speaker: DIFFORD
turns.text: The game will guide you.

turns.speaker: DIFFORD
turns.text: So what do you think?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Sign me up.

turns.speaker: DIFFORD
turns.text: This is one of our newest projects. We're trying to get rid of joy-sticks altogether ...

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: The Air-Force is working on the same thing.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: It means she's screwed up.

turns.speaker: STILTS
turns.text: Fucked up.  That's what they said I was.

turns.speaker: STILTS
turns.text: Cool.

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Can you say anything but "cool"?

turns.speaker: STILTS
turns.text: Of course I can.  I can say all sorts of things...

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: One of these cities, is the place you seek. The Teller of Truths will take you there. But the City of Lies, is dark and bleak. And death is certain if you enter, beware.

turns.speaker: STILTS
turns.text: I am The Liar.  Where should I take you?

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: I am the Truth Teller.  Where should I take you?

turns.speaker: STILTS
turns.text: So start at the beginning...

turns.speaker: LAURIE
turns.text: Give her a chance, will you?

turns.speaker: STILTS
turns.text: I am giving her a chance.  Why don't you get off my back?

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Adam, where are you?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: What's going on, Cynthia?

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: They've closed the set. They sent everybody home.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: What did you say?

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: They fired everyone.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Who fired everyone?

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Ray did ... and then they closed the set.... everybody's gone. You'd better get down here Adam!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: You've got to talk to Ray you've got to fix this.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I'm going home.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Home! Meet me at the office. We've got to do something ... you've got to do something Adam!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I'm going home Cynthia.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Adam, this isn't like you. Please come to the office. There must be something we can do.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I'm going home. I'll call you later.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Someone's shut off my money!

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: I know.  Where are you Adam?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: What do you mean "you know"?

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Someone called me. When they couldn't get you they told me you were as good as broke. I didn't believe then, so I made some calls.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: And?

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: You're broke!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: But I'm not broke.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: I know, but you're broke. Where are you?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Beverly Hills Hotel. I've got enough cash in my pocket for one night.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Do you know somebody called the The Cowboy?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: The Cowboy??

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Yeah, the Cowboy. This guy, the Cowboy, wants to see you. Jason said he thought it would be a good idea.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Oh, Jason thought it would be a good idea for me to meet the Cowboy. Should I wear my ten gallon hat and my six shooters?

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Something tells me this guy is connected with what's happening, Adam, and I think you should do it and I think you should do it right away.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Cynthia...what's going on?

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: It's been a very strange day.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: And getting stranger. Where do I meet this Cowboy? I mean do I have to ride out to the range?

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Sort of, funny boy. If I tell him the meeting's on you're to go to the top of Beachwood Canyon. There's a corral up there where he'll be.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: You gotta be kidding?

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Will you meet with him?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Yeah, sure. It is that kind of a day. When?

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: I'll call him, then call you back...If you want you could stay at my place.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Cynthia... that would not be a good idea.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: I'm just offering a place to stay.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I understand, Cynthia and thank you for the offer. I'll find a place. Now go ahead and give the Cowboy a yodel and get back to me.

turns.speaker: CYNTHIA
turns.text: Okay, but you don't know what you're missing.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Git along little dowgie and call me back.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: So what's the problem?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: There is no problem.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: So why did you idiots bring me here? ... I'm in the middle of making a picture.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: We'd be happy to put her in the pile for considerations ... you'd be pleased to know there's quite a lot of interest in this role.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Interest?! There's six of the top actresses that want this thing.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: You'd better fix this, Ray!!!

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I'll speak to someone.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: And you'd better speak to someone too ... or find yourself another client!! This smells like a set-up to me!  And by the way, Ray, I don't know who these guys are kidding, but every foot of film I've shot is in a vault at the lab that only I can access. No one's getting that film!!

turns.speaker: COWBOY
turns.text: Howdy!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Howdy to you.

turns.speaker: COWBOY
turns.text: Beautiful night.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: COWBOY
turns.text: Sure want to thank ya for drivin' all the way up to see me from that Beverly Hills Hotel.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: No problem. What's on your mind?

turns.speaker: COWBOY
turns.text: Well now, here's a man who wants to get right to it. Kinda anxious to get to it are ya?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Whatever.

turns.speaker: COWBOY
turns.text: A man's attitude ... a man's attitude goes some ways toward how a man's life will be. Is that somethin' you agree with?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: COWBOY
turns.text: Now... did you answer cause you thought that's what I wanted to hear or did you think about what I said and answer cause you truly believe that to be right?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I agree with what you said...truly.

turns.speaker: COWBOY
turns.text: What did I say?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: That a man's attitude determines to a large extent how his life will be.

turns.speaker: COWBOY
turns.text: So since you agree I guess you could be a person who does not care about the good life.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: How's that?

turns.speaker: COWBOY
turns.text: Well, just stop for a little second and think about it. Will ya do that for me?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Okay, I'm thinking.

turns.speaker: COWBOY
turns.text: No. You're too busy being a smart aleck to be thinkin'. Now I want ya to think and quit bein' such a smart aleck. Can ya do that for me?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Look ... where's this going? What do you want me to do?

turns.speaker: COWBOY
turns.text: There's sometimes a buggy. How many drivers does a buggy have?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: One.

turns.speaker: COWBOY
turns.text: So let's just say I'm drivin' this buggy and you fix your attitude and you can ride along with me.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: COWBOY
turns.text: Now I know a few things. I know you have had a rough day. You're probably thinkin' I don't know the half of it, but in actual fact I know every part of it. The business of gittin' thrown off your movie, the heartache of seeing your wife with another man... losin' access to that precious film vault...

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: It will work out.

turns.speaker: COWBOY
turns.text: Good then, but, just in case, that bank's gonna stay closed a bit longer. You understand that?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I understand.

turns.speaker: COWBOY
turns.text: You're an understandin' fella.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: So, this is the last time I see you then unless I do bad?

turns.speaker: COWBOY
turns.text: No, this one doesn't count. It's part of the original one. So then ... until we meet again.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Yes...what is it?

turns.speaker: HOTEL MANAGER
turns.text: I'm sorry Mr. Kesher, but there seems to be some problem concerning your credit card.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: ... What??

turns.speaker: HOTEL MANAGER
turns.text: The fact is Mr. Kesher a representative of your bank called us.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: How...  how'd they know I was here?

turns.speaker: HOTEL MANAGER
turns.text: I don't know. All we do is take an impression of the credit card and until you check out it just sits in our files.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: So, what did they say?

turns.speaker: HOTEL MANAGER
turns.text: Well, Sir, I'm afraid they said you're overdrawn at your bank and your line of credit has been cancelled.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Unbelievable. Look... here.  I don't know what's going on. That's so much baloney. I've got enough cash for one night, okay?

turns.speaker: HOTEL MANAGER
turns.text: That's fine, Mr. Kesher. You can pay cash when you check out. I'm sorry. it was my duty to inform you.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Fine. I'll check out in the morning.

turns.speaker: HOTEL MANAGER
turns.text: Have a good evening, Mr. Kesher.

turns.speaker: COCO
turns.text: I guess it was your grandfather, was it ... he called me to check in, said you were on your way and for you to call when you get in. Nice man... farmer I hear.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Yes, he is. He raises corn.

turns.speaker: COCO
turns.text: Damn lot of corn raised in Hollywood these days too.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Well, I ...

turns.speaker: COCO
turns.text: You don't have to tell me. It's written all over that pretty face of yours.. You came here to be an actress. I just hope you'll remember there's never been a great poem called "tits and ass."

turns.speaker: COCO
turns.text: You probably don't remember her, but Louise Bonner lives right over there in number 29. When she isn't drunk she runs a damn good acting class.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Have many famous actors and actresses lived here? I was meaning to ask you that.

turns.speaker: COCO
turns.text: Honey, all the great ones came through here at one time or another.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I guess I've come to quite a place.

turns.speaker: COCO
turns.text: Sweetheart, you don't know the half of it.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: No, I don't.

turns.speaker: COCO
turns.text: That's good. They're allowed, but I don't like 'em...for obvious reasons. One man used to live here that had a prize fighting kangaroo. You wouldn't believe what that kangaroo did to this courtyard ... let's see your Aunt's apartment ... it's a good one.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I can hardly wait, Coco.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: It's unbelievable!

turns.speaker: COCO
turns.text: I told ya.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Wow!

turns.speaker: COCO
turns.text: Now I guess you and your Aunt have an understanding. So here's the key and you need anything, just give a holler.  Everybody in this building's pretty much okay with me or they wouldn't be here. If you want, later I'll introduce you around. No hard feelings if you don't, and don't forget the rooftop garden. It's just up the stairs we passed. It's open to all the tenants. You can see the Hollywood sign from there.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Oh Coco thank you. Thank you so much.

turns.speaker: COCO
turns.text: You got it! See you later honey.

turns.speaker: COCO
turns.text: Your Aunt called me.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I was afraid of that.

turns.speaker: COCO
turns.text: She wants to know who's staying in her apartment.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: It's just for a night or two, until she finds her own place. I tried to explain that to Aunt Ruth, but the connection was bad and her plane was leaving and she got it all mixed up. I kept telling her it was my friend and she kept saying she didn't know any Ritas ...

turns.speaker: COCO
turns.text: Sweetie, look at me straight.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Coco...she's very nice. We went to school together.

turns.speaker: COCO
turns.text: So I guess your Grandpa and Grandma know her.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Not really. I met her in junior college and she was from this other town.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You're really something Coco...thank you.

turns.speaker: COCO
turns.text: Don't make me out to be a sucker. Louise Bonner says there's trouble in there. You remember last night. Sometimes she's wrong, but if there is trouble - get rid of it.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Sorry to trouble you, Coco.

turns.speaker: COCO
turns.text: It's all right gorgeous. Something wrong?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: No, no. I'm on my way to my audition. Before I go I wanted to ask you if you could remember the man's name ... Aunt Ruthie's friend who helped put this together. It completely went out of my mind.

turns.speaker: COCO
turns.text: His name's Wally Brown .... great guy. Been in the business since forever.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Thanks Coco. It'd be so embarrassing

turns.speaker: COCO
turns.text: Naw! He wouldn't have cared. Just give him a good performance and he'll be happy and I've got a feeling you'll do just that.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Thanks Coco. I'll let you know.

turns.speaker: COCO
turns.text: Get going. You don't want to be late.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Right. See ya.

turns.speaker: COCO
turns.text: Good luck, honey!

turns.speaker: DARK-HAIRED WOMAN
turns.text: That's okay.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I'm Ruth's niece. My name's Betty. I'm sure she told you I was coming.

turns.speaker: DARK-HAIRED WOMAN
turns.text: There was an accident. I came here.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I understand. I saw the dress. I...I'm sorry.   Are you all right?

turns.speaker: DARK-HAIRED WOMAN
turns.text: A car ... a car accident.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Are you okay?

turns.speaker: DARK-HAIRED WOMAN
turns.text: I think so. I was just taking a shower.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Oh my god. I'm sorry. I'll let you get back to that. I'm going to get unpacked.

turns.speaker: DARK-HAIRED WOMAN
turns.text: My name is Rita.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Hi...do you work with my Aunt?

turns.speaker: WALLY
turns.text: Betty Elms?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: WALLY
turns.text: I'm Wally Brown. Your Aunt is a very dear friend of mine so it's particularly nice to meet you.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Very pleased to meet you.

turns.speaker: WALLY
turns.text: Come in. I'd like you to meet everyone.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: WALLY
turns.text: Well. Shall we get to it? Would you like a water or a coffee before we begin?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: No, no, I'm fine.

turns.speaker: WALLY
turns.text: Well then, take a seat everyone. Betty why don't you join Jimmy and we'll play the scene. Is there anything you'd like to say Bob... something to Betty before they begin?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Just tell me where it hurts, baby.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I want to play this one close, Bob. Like it was with that girl, what's her name, with the black hair. That felt good. Whaddya think?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Betty.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Yeah ... Betty. You don't rush it. I don't rush it. We play it close, just like in the movies.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You're still here?

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: I came back. I thought that's what you wanted.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I can call them... I can call my dad.

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: But you won't.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Stop... just stop! That's what you said from the beginning. If I tell what happened... they'll arrest you and put you in jail, so get out of here before...

turns.speaker: JIMMY
turns.text: Before what?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Hi. I'm inquiring ...well, I heard a sound last night that sounded like a car crash and I want to know if there was an accident on Mulholland Drive.

turns.speaker: SERGEANT BAXTER
turns.text: Yes, there was.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Can you tell me what happened?

turns.speaker: SERGEANT BAXTER
turns.text: No. I can't.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Was anyone hurt?

turns.speaker: SERGEANT BAXTER
turns.text: May I have your name please?

turns.speaker: MIDDLE-AGED WOMAN
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Diane?

turns.speaker: MIDDLE-AGED WOMAN
turns.text: Number 17.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: But it said #12.

turns.speaker: MIDDLE-AGED WOMAN
turns.text: I switched apartments with her. She's in #17. Just walk down that way. It's just to the right.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Well ... we'll leave her a note.

turns.speaker: MIDDLE-AGED WOMAN
turns.text: I'll go with you. She's still got some of my stuff.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I...I mean......I...it's none of my business.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: She has pretty red hair... she is very kind I think.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: She sure is. She's letting me stay here while she's working on a movie that's being made in Canada, but I guess you know that.  I couldn't afford a place like this in a million years. Unless of course I'm discovered and become a movie star. Of course, I'd rather be known as a great actress than a movie star, but sometimes people end up being both and that is, I guess you'd say, sort of why I came here. I'm sorry, I'm just so excited to be here..I mean I just came here from Iowa and now I'm in this dream place. You can imagine how I feel.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: I think I've been hurt.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Oh...

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: But, this could be serious.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: No...I need to sleep.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: If you have a concussion you shouldn't sleep.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: It will be okay if I sleep. I need to lie down and sleep.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: All right, but...I'm going to check on you.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: What is it Rita?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: I'm...I'm... oh no... I thought when I woke up... I thought sleep would do it ...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: I don't know who I am.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: What do you mean? You're Rita.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: I'm not. I don't know what my name is. I don't know who I am!!

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Well...  what do you think about then? I mean...  well what do you think about?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Well ... if you don't remember anything, I mean what goes through your mind then if you don't remember anything?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Nothing. I do remember the car crash... I told you... I remember the glass ... I think about that sometimes ... I remember walking here, sort of. Now I remember this place and you. That's about it.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: How do you remember how to talk?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You don't remember anything else?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: No  There is something...something there I can't tell... I can't describe it.  There are things there.... but I'm... here.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: The money. You don't know where it came from?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Unh, unh.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: When you think about them... the money... the key ... does it make you remember anything?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Mulholland Drive.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Mulholland Drive?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: That's where I was going... Mulholland Drive.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Maybe that's where the accident was. There must be a police report. We could call.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: No.... I don't...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: We could call anonymously from a pay phone... just to see if there was an accident.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Okay... but just...just to see.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Just to see if there was an accident on Mulholland Drive.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Come on... let's find you something to wear.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: There's nothing?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Not that I can see.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: No. Just the coffee.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: We'll take our check.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Strange to be calling yourself.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Maybe it's not me.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Call the number.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: It's not my voice ... but I know her.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Maybe the voice isn't Diane Selwyn. Maybe that's your roommate or if it is Diane Selwyn she can tell you who you are.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Maybe...maybe ... maybe.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: What's wrong with that?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: I'm not sure about this.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I know you're afraid of something. We'll be careful. Tomorrow we'll go over there and we'll find out.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: "You're still here?"

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: "I came back. I thought that's what you wanted."

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: "Really?"

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: "My parents are right upstairs! They think you've left..."

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: "So... surprise"...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: "I can call them... I can call my dad... "

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: "But you won't..."

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: "You're playing a dangerous game here. If you're trying to blackmail me... it's not going to work."

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: "You know what I want...it's not that difficult."

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: "Get out! Get out before I call my dad ... he trusts you ... your his best friend. This will be the end of everything... "

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: "What about you? What will your dad think about you?"

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: "Stop! Just Stop! That's what you said from the beginning. If I tell what happened... they'll arrest you and put you in jail, so get out of here before..."

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: "Before what?"

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: "Before I kill you."

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: "Then they'd put you in jail."

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Oh, no wonder I'm starving. I'm going to fix a sandwich. You want one?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: I'm all right.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You've got to eat something. You're just nervous about going over to see if you're Diane Selwyn.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Is everything all right? Is it bad for you that I'm here?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Everything is A-okay, but I've gotta get that sandwich!

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I hope I'm back in a couple of hours. Don't drink all the coke.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Good luck!

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: When I get back I'll have the cab waiting, so be ready to go.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Why didn't you ask him? Sol knows you!

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: But I don't know, Sol. I never heard of Sol. I'd just get in trouble. That's why we shouldn't go see about Diane Selwyn... it's better not to get in trouble.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: You're not going to get in trouble. You're going to find out who you are. Finding out who you are gets you out of trouble.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Don't stop!

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: What is it? What do you see?!

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Those men in front, in the car.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Do you know them?!

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: No... but...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Keep going. Go around to the back.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: I don't think...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: C'mon help me in. I'll open the front door.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Rita... I know what you're doing.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: What ... I..HAVE... to do.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I know what you have to do, but let me do it.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Rita... I want you to stay here and you don't have to give me that money.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: But I want to.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: No. We shouldn't touch that money. We don't know about that money. That might be dangerous money. You have to start all over again. You look like a brand new person and you can be a brand new person... whoever you want to be.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: It sounds kind of nice ... being somebody brand new.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Hey, let's introduce the brand new you to Hollywood. We haven't seen the roof garden yet.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: To my audition.

turns.speaker: PARAMOUNT GUARD
turns.text: And who are we auditioning for today?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Wally Brown.

turns.speaker: PARAMOUNT GUARD
turns.text: And do we know which of the fifty-seven buildings Wally Brown is in?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: No, we don't.

turns.speaker: PARAMOUNT GUARD
turns.text: Well, now we've got to figure that out first don't we?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Yes, Sir.

turns.speaker: PARAMOUNT GUARD
turns.text: Mr.Wallace Brown is in the Executive Building on the second floor. We want to go in and turn right at the first street. Then we want to walk three blocks down past Stage 17 to the white Executive Building. Once we're on the second floor the receptionist will take us from there. Now do we have name?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Betty Elms.

turns.speaker: PARAMOUNT GUARD
turns.text: Let's see if we have a pass for Betty Elms ... and we do. Here we go. And good luck Miss. Elms.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Thank you... thank you very much.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Yeah, sure. Look what happened to them.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: No, no, no, I told you. They're fine. They're all real happy.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: My next delivery is up that way, so I'll be getting down to it real soon.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You're so easy.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Gotta keep an eye on her, that's all.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Yeah, what for?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Keep her from gettin' in trouble, that's all.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What's  the matter now?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Nothing... I don't like being out in the open like this.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: It must be just so pathetic being you. Sure Billy, grab your dog we'll eat in the van.

turns.speaker: HERB
turns.text: Why did you want to go to breakfast if you're not hungry?

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: I just wanted to come here.

turns.speaker: HERB
turns.text: To Denny's? I wasn't going to say anything, but why Denny's?

turns.speaker: DAN
turns.text: This Denny's.

turns.speaker: HERB
turns.text: Okay. Why this Denny's?
